title: Inconsistent: Tensor repeat method is 1-indexed, not 0-indexed
body_html:
On 0.3.1b0+2b47480 on macOS, built from source.

E.g.
a = torch.Tensor([[5,2]])
a.repeat(2,0)

errors out, but

a.repeat(2,1)
returns the 2x2 tensor that I would anticipate from the first attempt.

It appears that the repeat method is indexing dimensions from 1, not 0.

torch.cat indexes dimensions from 0. I thought the repeat method should be consistent.

`a.repeat(2,1)`
